entries.title: Unable to set the system proxy on macOS when adapter name has multiple spaces next to each other
Unable to set the system proxy on macOS default Thunderbolt adapters
The system proxy is not respected when starting the application on macOS in some cases
The system proxy is not used for some of the initial requests during application startup
Add a text input to search in the URL and Headers of all sessions
Add an option to Share Feedback for the app
Enable sorting of captured traffic
Improve the app architecture to reduce the CPU usage during Live Traffic capturing
Migrate the login to case-insensitive system. Added specific UI for cases where the migration requires merge of multiple accounts in a single one
Update Electron to version 11, Angular to version 11 and .NET to version 5
Trust and enable certificate from grid icon sometimes does not set the 'Capture HTTPS traffic' to on
The app is not restarted after update on macOS Big Sur
ESC key does not close the Settings dialog
The app may fail to start when HTTPS_PROXY and HTTP_PROXY env variables are set
Traffic to localhost is not captured by default on macOS and Linux
Errors are raised when executing 'Check for updates' multiple times
The app's state is incorrect when there's no access to *.getfiddler.com
High memory usage during sharing
Add option to show Release Notes inside the app
Add 'Reset root certificate' option in the Settings
Add 'Remove root certificate' option in the Settings
The app does not work If any of the bash profiles has commands that print on the terminal (macOS and Linux)
The app does not capture traffic when 'Require an administrator password to access system-wide preferences' option is checked (macOS)
Rules Builder returns incorrect response when creating a rule from session and original response is encoded
The app is crashing silently when due to not enough memory for starting the .NET Core process
Requests to localhost are not captured on Windows in some cases
Autoupdate does not work on Windows when user does not have access to Machine registry
Coloring is not applied in the Response Body inspectors on the first Composer execution
Analytics improvements
Show information for the HTTP Status code, Body Size, HTTP Version, Method in the Inspectors
Automatically select the most appropriate inspector when opening session, for example if the body content is JSON, the JSON inspector will be automatically selected.
Improve decode of sessions and move the button to be in the Inspectors sections
Add support for zoom in and zoom out
Import all formats to a new tab instead of loading them in the Live Traffic
Remove File menu and improve Import/Export UI
Add Context Menu option to export selected/unselected/all sessions directly to a specific format (without saving them in the local storage of the application)
Add keyboard and menu options for working with the window on macOS – hide, show others, etc.
Add keyboard and menu option for opening Settings
Add keyboard and menu options for navigating between tabs
Added and improved tooltips for all buttons
Log information for CPU and memory usage
UI in Sign In page is misaligned
Remote IP Column is not populated when importing Http Archive (HAR)
Validation messages for names of Folders in the Sessions tree on the left are incorrect.

Support ignore of server certificate errors – now you are able to set this (in the Settings) and work with your internal resources, for which you do not have a valid certificate. You can enable this through application's settings.

Support decode of Brotli (BR) Content Encoding – a popular encoding used in Firebase and many other popular resources – until now the responses were not readable, but with this release you just need to enable the decode option and the content will be converted to a human-readable one.

Improve Body, Date and Duration columns – we’ve used the opportunity to further improve the information we show to the users – the Body column is now called Body Size, it can be filtered with numeric comparison (was text before) and it has the unit. For Duration column we’ve also changed the filter to be numeric and we’ve added the unit. The Date column’s filter is now Calendar based, which makes it easy to get the information you need for specific date range. With all those changes we unlock new scenarios of using Fiddler Everywhere: finding sessions which take more than specified time has never been so easy. The same is valid for finding requests above specified size, etc.

Add predefined responses for Rule Builder rules – in Fiddler Classic there was an easy way to create responses for specific HTTP Codes, like 404, 301, etc. Now, the same is valid for Fiddler Everywhere – just create (edit) your AR rules and use the predefined responses from there. With a few clicks you can simulate 404 or 200 and see how your code behaves in this situation.

Add Client IP column – we’ve added a new column (it will be manually included in the list from the Columns menu) which shows the Client IP from which the request has been executed. This is extremely helpful when you capture requests from mobile devices and your machine as well.
Integrate in-app nudges – with this release we can now send targeted information (for webinars for example) to users who have allowed user tracking.
Add Open Application Logs Folder menu option –use the Help menu and the folder with the logs will be opened.
Set Fiddler Everywhere as default for opening .saz and .har files – with this release Fiddler Everywhere will be set as default for those file types.
Some OS commands cause errors on Fiddler Everywhere start on Windows
Shared sessions with size bigger than 5MB are corrupted.
Error is shown in logs when environment variable ASPNETCORE_ENVIRONMENT is set to Development
Edit in Composer option was shown for CONNECT requests, which is not applicable
Shortcuts are working even if context menu option is disabled
Deeplinking does not work on Linux when the app is not running
The root folders in the session tree can be deleted with shortcut
Maximize/restore icon is incorrect on Windows and Linux
Overlay of My Resources dialog does not cover everything on Linux
